page.title: 19LLANWERN STEELWORKS,NEWPORT
page.content:
Llanwern steel works were built by Richard,Thomas and Baldwin (RTB), but was nationalised by the Labour Government to join the BSC group.
When Llanwern was in full production in the 1970's it had the largest steel output in Europe.
There has been a large reduction in the number of people employed in Llanwern. This has affected the job prospects of young people in this area.
Llanwern's future is in the balance, because the EEC is pressurising for a cut in steel production in the United Kingdom. The workforce has fought this and the plant has become profitable after making huge losses in the past.
